alarms.activeAlarmsMapTips: Display the distribution map of all active alarms.
alarms.historicalAlarmsMapTips: Display the distribution map of all historical alarms.
alarms.closeTitle: Do you want to close this item?
alarms.closeContent: After closing, the data cannot be recovered.
alarms.declareIncidentErrorMsg: The selected alert is already linked to an incident
alarms.title: Title

settings.assignStrategyMessage: You can configure an automatic dispatch strategy to assign alerts that meet the filtering criteria to designated personnel and choose the notification method.
settings.shieldStrategyMessage: By implementing a blocking strategy, you can manage the sending of alarm information more efficiently, improving the efficiency and user experience of the alarm system.
settings.correlationRulesMessage: Explore the correlation between low-level events and aggregate them into high-level events. Here, you can define aggregation rules from ‘Event’ to ‘Alert’ and ‘Alert’ to ‘Incident’ to reduce the amount of information that needs to be processed and improve the information value of individual events.
settings.name: Name

correlation.slidingMsg: There are two key parameters for sliding windows, namely window size and sliding step size. It will slide forward with a fixed step size, and there is overlap between the windows. Suitable for partial context linkage analysis, such as checking a single server's past 1-minute Event every 10 seconds, generating an Alert when a fatal level Event occurs, and continuously aggregating the Event into one Alert for comprehensive analysis of faults.
correlation.fixedMsg: Also known as a rolling window, it is characterized by a fixed time length and no overlap between windows, meaning that the window time is the same as the step size. Suitable for aggregation calculations with clear requirements for time range, such as triggering an alarm if the number of errors exceeds 100 within an hour.
correlation.sessionMsg: The boundary of the session window is determined by the interval time between events (session timeout or specific events). If no new events arrive within the specified time, the current window will close and a new window will open for subsequent events. Suitable for analyzing user session related scenarios, such as: after pipeline packaging failure, if there is no further processing within 10 minutes, it means that the code problem cannot be solved in a short period of time and an alarm is issued

assignStrategy.frequencyMsg: Default notification once during alarm assignment
assignStrategy.notRespondMsg: When the alarm does not respond，

globalConfig.title: Unallocated Alarm Notification
globalConfig.description: When there are unassigned alarms, notify the designated person in charge of the alarm

operationLog.title: Operation Log
operationLog.description: Display all historical records of additions, deletions, and modifications, and you can search based on conditions such as operator/operation type/time
